function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Ineffective use of 5g networks in healthcare without other technologies","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of emerging technologies for covid-19 management","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited availability of multimodal sensing systems for covid-19 symptoms hinders comprehensive disease monitoring and prevention.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of ai and deep learning for covid-19 diagnosis and prevention.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Forecasting pandemic spread using ai and data analysis.","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Smartwatch data collection and heuristic model used for disease detection","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Application of ai in medical research and social context during pandemic","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on ai for outcome prediction","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges related to the design trade-offs, improved sensors, power, size, computation algorithms, and security","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the use of hems technologies and the interaction with end-users","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Technology anxiety","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to increased use of telemedical services and community updates","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Cybersecurity and technology anxiety may deter the adoption of smart home technologies with disease-containment features.","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Minimal involvement from users and healthcare professionals in wearable technology may lead to reliance on technology and potential negligence of other diagnostic and preventive measures.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wearable technology for early covid-19 detection","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scoping reviews on the intersection of wearable technology and covid-19","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of search terms and index terms","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider language restrictions in the search strategy","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Anomaly detection models relying on wearable technology data may not be device-agnostic, leading to limitations in generalizability and applicability to different devices.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Manual selection of physiological characteristics for anomaly detection model development may lead to biased or incomplete feature sets, impacting the effectiveness of the models.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited external validation of anomaly detection models may result in overfitting to specific datasets, reducing the models’ generalizability and reliability.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unsupervised machine learning used to segment data into infectious and noninfectious periods, leading to potential misclassification of covid-19 infection periods.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of validation standards for wearable technology used in early detection of covid-19, leading to inconsistent accuracy results and unreliable performance.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent accuracy results and heterogenous specificity and sensitivity values in wearable technology for covid-19 detection, leading to uncertainty in the performance of the technology.","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wearable technology not being device-agnostic and unable to distinguish covid-19 infection from other diagnoses","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of a closed facebook group for educational purposes","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implementing flipped classroom technique for conferences","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Institution of separate tracks for junior and senior residents","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Some faculty struggling with novel technology and poor bandwidth connections for participants","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased dependence on telehealth clinics using online video conference software","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using a permissioned blockchain for providing data sharing from the medical perspective.","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on blockchain for data control and access","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of iot data collection system to cyber attacks","category":"Data privacy and security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standardized exergame protocols","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited scientific work and research on exergame interventions","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of organizational, environmental, and personal measures","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Entrenched cartesian-newtonian mechanistic scientific paradigm","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of dynamic modeling and population-based kalman filter approach introduces a risk of model complexity and interpretation challenges.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalized iptcc index as a measure of transmission conditions","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Complex modeling of disease dynamics","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Model measurement errors","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex mathematical modeling of disease transmission and estimation procedures.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coupling of dynamics across regions in the population-based estimate","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of prior knowledge to force variables in the population to be constant","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assuming a time-dependent function for the wiener process may lead to inaccurate estimation of the transmission rate.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overfitting the model could lead to inaccurate distinctions between the latent trajectory of transmission rate and noise in observations.","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear prior for dynamics of b may lead to inaccuracies in model predictions.","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of overfitting due to inclusion of multiple interaction effects","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of transmission rates using population-based kalman filters may result in inaccurate data if not properly validated","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the association between transmission rates and npi, weather, and voc","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
